segments.text: I see the mom just standing there, drying that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even notice the water or the kids, and it’s kind of sad.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just tired or if she’s always this distracted.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being sneaky, but she’s not even paying attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for her because she’s missing everything that’s happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and she doesn’t even react.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she doesn’t get in trouble later for the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems so focused on that one task, like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’d be happier if she just took a break and looked outside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just making me feel a little sad for her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she realizes what’s going on before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
